parameter.name: region
parameter.label: AWS region ID
parameter.description:
AWS region ID as described in Step 2 in Setting up Amazon account.
The region needs to match the region of the AWS user that will access Amazon DynamoDB.
For example, eu-west-1.

parameter.name: accessKey
parameter.label: AWS access key
parameter.description:
AWS access key of the AWS user that will access Amazon DynamoDB.
Give either 1) access key and secret key, or 2) credentials file and profile name.

parameter.name: secretKey
parameter.label: AWS secret key
parameter.description:
AWS secret key of the AWS user that will access Amazon DynamoDB.
Give either 1) access key and secret key, or 2) credentials file and profile name.

parameter.name: profilesConfigFile
parameter.label: AWS credentials file
parameter.description:
Path to the AWS credentials file.
For example, /etc/openhab2/aws_creds. Please note that the user that runs openHAB must have approriate read rights to the credential file.
Give either 1) access key and secret key, or 2) credentials file and profile name.

parameter.name: profile
parameter.label: Profile name
parameter.description:
Name of the profile to use in AWS credentials file
Give either 1) access key and secret key, or 2) credentials file and profile name.

parameter.name: readCapacityUnits
parameter.description: Read capacity for the created tables. Default is 1.
parameter.label: Read capacity

parameter.name: writeCapacityUnits
parameter.label: Write capacity
parameter.description: Write capacity for the created tables. Default is 1.

parameter.name: tablePrefix
parameter.label: Table prefix
parameter.description: Table prefix used in the name of created tables. Default is openhab-
